The claim made by President Donald Trump: 2. Multiple news outlets reported that the suspect, Sayfullo Habibullaevic Saipov, got married in the United States in 2013 to a woman who already lived there, and their three children were all born in the United States.
Stephen H: Legomsky, an emeritus professor at the Washington University School of Law, stated that unless Saipov had 22 unmarried, under-age-21 children at the time he entered the United States, Trump's statement is clearly false.
